cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles E of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning north then north-northeast, aiming for landfall along the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast LA – MS/AL coast)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the MS/AL coastline (around Biloxi–Gulfport area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning extends east of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL (Florida Panhandle)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Navarre FL; Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy gusts possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the west-central Florida coast, but not expected to exceed 3 ft at Port Manatee
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain over west-central Florida
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and dangerous rip-current conditions along the Gulf beaches
